resources.string:
With AnkiDroid, you can efficiently learn large amounts of vocabulary or any other material. AnkiDroid shows you the things to learn just before you forget them.

To get a first impression of how everything works, we recommend to start with a tutorial deck, which will give you some initial information, and try a bit out. Just click on "Start Reviewing" after having opened it.

Create the tutorial deck now?
Database checked and optimized.\nShrunk by %d kb
您確定要刪除所有%s中的卡片嗎?
Are you sure you wish to send all cards in %s back to their original decks?
Market 中有更新版本的 Ankidroid。您要安裝嗎？
This resets the learning progress for all cards of this note (they will look like new cards).\nReally continue?
All cards of this note reset

An error occurred while writing to the collection. This could be related to a corrupt database or to insufficient disc space.

If it happens more often, please try to check the database, repair the collection or restoring it from a backup. Click on 'options' for that.

Nevertheless, it could be an AnkiDroid bug as well; please report the error that we can check this.
您真的想要修復資料庫嗎?\n\n在開始修復之前, 會先複製一份備份檔案放置於資料夾\'%s\'中.
To add cards to AnkiDroid remove all Notepad categories or add one named \'default\'
Increase today\'s new card limit by
Review cards forgotten in last x days:
Select x cards randomly from the deck:
Preview new cards added in the last x days:

string-array.name: about_content
string-array.item:
%1$s:
Flashcards for Android

AnkiDroid is a flashcard application which is fully compatible with the desktop software Anki. You can create, download and learn contents on both, AnkiDroid or Anki Desktop, and synchronize them very easily.
To help us make AnkiDroid better, please report any bug here; new feature ideas are very welcome too! Please use the wiki and say Hi on the forum.
AnkiDroid is open source software, so everyone is encouraged to join the contributors:-)
Non-developers can also help, for instance by translating AnkiDroid, updating the wiki and screenshots, donating to Anki Desktop, or blogging about AnkiDroid!
AnkiDroid is released under the GNU-GPL v3 license and the source code is available here.
